intro: Alangium chinense subsp. strigosum, commonly known as the hairy alangium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. This subspecies is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
